org.sopra.api.exercises.exercise3

Interface ResidualEdge<V>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CapacityEdge<V>, Edge<V>

    public interface ResidualEdge<V>
extends CapacityEdge<V>
    This interface represents an edge in a residual network. Each edge keeps track of its start- & end-point, its capacity, and its reverse residual edge, if in existence. Adding or removing a unit of flow from an edge works by decreasing or increasing the capacity of this edge as appropriate, then increasing or decreasing the capacity of its residual edge appropriately.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addFlow(int amount)
      Adds or subtracts the indicated number of flow units across this edge.
      ResidualEdge<V> getReverse()
      Returns the reverse edge.
      void setReverse(ResidualEdge<V> reverse)
      Sets the reverse edge associated with this edge.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.sopra.api.model.CapacityEdge

        getCapacity, setCapacity

      • Methods inherited from interface org.sopra.api.model.Edge

        getEnd, getStart

    • Method Detail

      • addFlow

        void addFlow(int amount)
        Adds or subtracts the indicated number of flow units across this edge. Adding or removing a unit of flow from an edge works by decreasing or increasing the capacity of this edge as appropriate, then increasing or decreasing the capacity of its residual edge appropriately.
        Parameters:
        amount - of flow to be added or subtracted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if the amount of flow added or removed from this edge exceeds the capacity of this edge

      • getReverse

        ResidualEdge<V> getReverse()
        Returns the reverse edge.
        Returns:
        Reverse residual edge.
